intro: Hieracium sagittatum subsp. oxygonium, commonly known as the arrowhead hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves and yellowish-orange composite flowers. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this subspecies thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into achene fruits. It is often found in open habitats and is considered a common weed in agricultural areas.
